topic.title: Installing Couchbase Server
topic.shortdesc: Installing and configuring Couchbase Server is very straightforward.

body.p: Pick up the platform, the correct edition for your needs, and then download and run the installer.

section.title: Select Couchbase Server edition
section.p: Couchbase Server comes in two different editions: Enterprise Edition and Community Edition. There are some differences between them:

ul.li: Enterprise Edition (EE) is the latest stable version of Couchbase Server, which includes all the bug fixes and has passed a rigorous QA process. It is free for use for testing and development purposes. You need to purchase an annual support plan with this edition for production use.

Community Edition (CE) lags behind the EE by about one release cycle and does not include all the latest fixes or commercial support. However, it is open source and entirely free for use in testing and, if youâ€™re very brave, in production. This edition is appropriate for enthusiasts and non-critical systems.

section.p: Once you are ready to give Couchbase a hands-on try, download the appropriate installation package for your system.

section.title: Download Couchbase Server
section.p: Couchbase Server is supported on numerous popular operating systems. Look for the binaries for your operating system on the Couchbase download page.
Each of the binaries listed on the download page has its appropriate install instructions.

section.title: On Linux systems
section.p: You can download Couchbase Server directly to a Linux system by using the wget or curl command.

section.title: On Windows systems
section.p: You can download Couchbase Server directly using the wget.exe command for Windows or Powershell scripting.

The basic syntax of the wget command is: $ wget [option]... [url]...For example, the following command downloads a version of Couchbase Server and that runs on Windows Server 2012 R2: $ wget.exe --no-check-certificate http://packages.couchbase.com/releases/version/couchbase-server-enterprise-version-windows_amd64.exe
